name: Sahibzada Zorawar Singh Ji
excerpt: Sahibzada Zorawar Singh Ji was the third son of Guru Gobind Singh Ji, martyred at the tender age of eight along with his younger brother Sahibzada Fateh Singh Ji, for refusing to convert to Islam under the orders of Wazir Khan, the Mughal Governor of Sirhind. His unwavering faith and supreme sacrifice are a beacon of courage in Sikh history.
